sections.title: Single Image With Caption
description: At first only one image to demonstrate the basic complex of image and caption

sections.title: With HTML <samp>figure</samp>
description: <samp>figure</samp> would be straighforward since it semantically clear encapsulates an image with a caption (<samp>figcaption</samp>). Unfortunatly it does not fit for <samp>overflow</samp> tweaking (see below).
notes: Styling is necessary to align the caption midth under the image.

sections.title: With HTML <samp>div</samp>
description: <samp>div</samp> is always suboptimal due to its lack of semantic and suits as a last resort only. With it there is also no semantically clear element for the image caption, the least complicated choice is <samp>p</samp> for containing a text block. Semantic roles should be expressed by classes (with class names that are not reflecting styling details).
notes: Styling is necessary to align the caption midth under the image.

sections.title: Image Series With Line Break
description: Too many images to fit in one row, so the browser will - like text - break into next line.
Three images should suffice here to break the margin.

sections.title: With HTML <samp>figure</samp>
notes: Additional styling is necessary to overwrite standard <samp>figure</samp> block display, i.e. "one figure per line"

sections.title: With HTML <samp>div</samp>
notes: Additional styling is necessary to overwrite standard <samp>div</samp> block display and for spacing (whitespace) between the divs

sections.title: Image Series Without Line Break
description: Images should be displayed in one line with horizontal scrolling.

sections.title: With HTML <samp>figure</samp>
notes: Requires an encapsulating <samp>div</samp> that controls the <samp>overflow</samp>.
Ordering in one horizontal line is now achieved with <samp>display: table-cell</samp>, for this a <samp>padding</samp> has to be defined (<samp>margin</samp> does not work for / between cells).

sections.title: With HTML <samp>div</samp>
notes: Requires an encapsulating <samp>div</samp> that controls the <samp>overflow</samp>.
Ordering in one horizontal line is now achieved with <samp>display: table-cell</samp>, for this a <samp>padding</samp> has to be defined (<samp>margin</samp> does not work for / between cells).

sections.title: Multiple Image Series Without Line Break
description: Multiple parallel lines of images scrolling together horizontally.

sections.title: With HTML <samp>figure</samp>
notes: Each row of images encapsulated in an own <samp>div</samp>, "controlled" by shared outer <samp>div</samp>.

sections.title: With HTML <samp>div</samp>
notes: Each row of images encapsulated in an own <samp>div</samp>, "controlled" by shared outer <samp>div</samp>.
